actor_awards.notes: Hardwicke was knighted by King George V in 1934 for his services to the theatre. He won the National Board of Review Award for Best Actor for his roles in 'King Solomon's Mines' (1937) and 'The Moon Is Down' (1943). He has two stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame: one for Motion Pictures and one for Television.

filmography.title: The Ten Commandments
filmography.role_description: The noble and just Pharaoh of Egypt who loves his adopted son Moses but is forced to banish him when his true Hebrew heritage is revealed.
filmography.plot: The Egyptian Prince Moses learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Effects; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Cheers (#79)

filmography.title: Rope
filmography.role_description: The gentle, unsuspecting father of the murder victim, who attends a dinner party hosted by his son's killers unaware that the body is hidden in the room.
filmography.plot: Two men attempt to prove they committed the perfect crime by hosting a dinner party for the victim's friends and family, with the body hidden inside a trunk in the center of the room.

filmography.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
filmography.role_description: The King's High Justice, a deeply pious but bigoted and repressed official who becomes obsessed with the gypsy Esmeralda and frames Quasimodo for her misfortunes.
filmography.plot: In 15th-century France, a gypsy girl is framed for murder by the infatuated Chief Justice, and only the deformed bellringer of Notre Dame Cathedral can save her.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Score, Best Sound

filmography.title: Suspicion
filmography.role_description: The stern, disapproving father of the protagonist who leaves her a portrait but no money in his will, adding to her financial and marital stress.
filmography.plot: A shy woman marries a charming gentleman, but begins to suspect he is a penniless gambler who plans to murder her for her inheritance.

filmography.title: The Ghost of Frankenstein
filmography.role_description: The second son of the original Frankenstein, a psychiatrist who is blackmailed by Ygor into transplanting a new brain into the Monster.
filmography.plot: Ygor resurrects Frankenstein's Monster and brings him to the original doctor's second son for a brain transplant, hoping to make the creature intelligent.

filmography.title: King Solomon's Mines
filmography.role_description: The legendary hunter and adventurer who leads a dangerous expedition into the African interior to find a lost diamond mine.
filmography.plot: A group of adventurers trek across the African desert and mountains to find the legendary diamond mines of King Solomon.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor (Cedric Hardwicke)

filmography.title: The Moon Is Down
filmography.role_description: A German commanding officer occupying a Norwegian town who tries to rule with logic and order but finds himself worn down by the town's quiet, unbreakable resistance.
filmography.plot: When Nazis invade a small Norwegian town, the citizens organize a resistance movement that slowly erodes the morale of the occupying soldiers.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor (Cedric Hardwicke)

filmography.title: Things to Come
filmography.role_description: A master craftsman and rebel leader in a future utopia who opposes the march of scientific progress and space travel.
filmography.plot: A decades-spanning sci-fi epic predicting a century of war, plague, and the rise of a technocratic super-state that aims to conquer the stars.

filmography.title: Les Misérables
filmography.role_description: The benevolent bishop whose act of kindness and mercy towards Jean Valjean sets the ex-convict on the path to redemption.
filmography.plot: In 19th-century France, a relentless policeman pursues an ex-convict who has reinvented himself as a mayor and factory owner.

filmography.title: Around the World in 80 Days
filmography.role_description: A British army officer stationed in India who accompanies Phileas Fogg on the elephant ride across the jungle.
filmography.plot: A Victorian gentleman bets that he can travel around the world in eighty days.

filmography.title: The Winslow Boy
filmography.role_description: A dedicated father who risks his health and fortune to sue the British Admiralty to clear his son's name after he is expelled from naval college.
filmography.plot: A father fights a long legal battle to clear his son's name after the boy is expelled from a naval college for stealing a postal order.

filmography.title: Stanley and Livingstone
filmography.role_description: The famous missing missionary and explorer whom Henry Stanley tracks down in the heart of Africa.
filmography.plot: New York reporter Henry M. Stanley sets out on a perilous journey through Africa to find the missing explorer Dr. David Livingstone.

filmography.title: A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur's Court
filmography.role_description: A perpetually stuffed-up and somewhat bumbling King Arthur who is charmed by the modern American mechanic who travels back in time.
filmography.plot: A singing mechanic from 1912 bumps his head and wakes up in Camelot in 528 AD, where he uses his modern know-how to impress the court.

filmography.title: I Remember Mama
filmography.role_description: A boarder in the Hanson household, a faded actor who reads classic literature to the family in the evenings.
filmography.plot: The story of a Norwegian immigrant family in 1910s San Francisco, centered on the loving and practical mother.

filmography.title: The Lodger
filmography.role_description: The suspicious landlord who begins to fear that his quiet new tenant might be the notorious Jack the Ripper.
filmography.plot: A landlady suspects her new lodger is Jack the Ripper when a wave of murders terrorizes the neighborhood.

filmography.title: Becky Sharp
filmography.role_description: A wealthy and lecherous nobleman who becomes the patron of the social-climbing Becky Sharp, demanding her affection in return.
filmography.plot: A social-climbing woman uses her wit and charm to ascend the ranks of British society during the Napoleonic Wars.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Color (first 3-strip Technicolor feature)

filmography.title: Wilson
filmography.role_description: The powerful Republican senator who becomes President Woodrow Wilson's fiercest political adversary and blocks the US entry into the League of Nations.
filmography.plot: A biography of Woodrow Wilson, from his days as Princeton University president to his presidency during World War I.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Screenplay, Best Cinematography

filmography.title: The Keys of the Kingdom
filmography.role_description: A high-ranking church official sent to investigate the unconventional career of an aging priest to determine his fitness for retirement.
filmography.plot: A Scottish priest establishes a mission in China and endures decades of hardship, war, and personal loss.

filmography.title: Nicholas Nickleby
filmography.role_description: The cruel, miserly uncle of the protagonist who refuses to help his impoverished relatives and seeks to exploit them.
filmography.plot: When his father dies, Nicholas Nickleby asks his wealthy uncle for help, only to find the man is a heartless tyrant.

filmography.title: Lured
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated businessman and suspect in the disappearance of several young women in London.
filmography.plot: A dancer in London disappears, and her friend goes undercover for Scotland Yard to catch the serial killer responsible.

filmography.title: Richard III
filmography.role_description: The ailing King of England whose death paves the way for his brother Richard's machinations to seize the throne.
filmography.plot: Richard, Duke of Gloucester, plots and murders his way to the throne of England in this adaptation of Shakespeare's play.

filmography.title: The Pumpkin Eater
filmography.role_description: Hardwicke's final film role, playing the father of Anne Bancroft's character in this intense marital drama.
filmography.plot: A woman who has had three husbands and many children suffers a breakdown as her current marriage collapses.

filmography.title: Invisible Agent
filmography.role_description: A ruthless Nazi Gestapo officer who tries to capture the invisible American agent to use his secrets for the Third Reich.
filmography.plot: The grandson of the original Invisible Man uses his secret formula to spy on the Nazis during World War II.

filmography.title: The Invisible Man Returns
filmography.role_description: The coal mining owner who frames his brother for murder, eventually revealed to be the true villain by the invisible protagonist.
filmography.plot: A man falsely accused of murdering his brother is given an invisibility drug by the original Invisible Man's brother to help him clear his name.

filmography.title: Five Weeks in a Balloon
filmography.role_description: A comedic role in this adventure film based on Jules Verne, involving a balloon race across Africa.
filmography.plot: A group of adventurers race to claim unclaimed territory in West Africa by traveling there in a hot air balloon.
